column4: hi all, can any one tell me how to make ubuntu stream computer name to a router?
let me explain it :) it might take some time as I'm from Polish and my english isn't good :_
I have a Netgear wgt634v2 router, with wireless enabled and WPA-PSK as a encryption method
also I'm using mac address filtering
if I am on windows and I go to mac address filter page and try to add router shows skwara-lap - MAC addr of wi-fi
can you just not manually enter the MAC address?
but if I''m on ubuntu and go to this page it shows Unknown - MAC Addr
so you need to enter the computer's mac address into a page on the router, right?
there's a radio with Unknown and Mac addres next to it (on the router's page) and under it there are two inputs, one for computer name and second for MAC
i believe you can put anything for the computer name, that is just there so you remember which computer is associated with the mac address
ok than, but why I cannot connect while I'm on ubuntu, and why there's Unknown on the router's page, while on windows there is my computer name that I've set
maybe it's the NetBIOS computer name? If you're router requires that, i'm not sure if there's a netbios service for linux

in windows' wifi connection I have checked check-box: Use NetBIOS settings from the DHCP server. If static IP address is used or the DHCP server deos not provide NetBIOS setting, enable NetBIOS over TCP/IP. So is there any chance to get it works whith MAC filter turned on?
i think you should turn off NetBIOS completely
on my router i can have dhcp hand out static IPs based on MAC address alone, i'm not sure about yours, but that would be better than using NetBIOS
I think there's no such option in my router
the problem is that there is not a netbios service running on ubuntu
